title: 1971 Limerick Senior Hurling Championship
text:
The 1971 Limerick Senior Hurling Championship was the 77th staging of the <a href="Limerick%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">Limerick Senior Hurling Championship</a> since its establishment by the <a href="Limerick%20GAA">Limerick County Board</a> in 1887.
<a href="Patrickswell%20GAA">Patrickswell</a> were the <a href="1970%20Limerick%20Senior%20Hurling%20Championship">defending champions</a>.
On 12 December 1971, <a href="Claughaun%20GAA">Claughaun</a> won the championship after a 6-06 to 2-13 defeat of <a href="South%20Liberties%20GAA">South Liberties</a> in the final. It was their ninth championship title overall and their first championship title in three years.
